definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: The basic idea is to write a program to analyze a shotgun’s shot pattern.
sentences.chinese: 基本的想法是写一个程序分析散弹枪的射击模式。

sentences.english: Actually, shotguns are very good home-defense weapons.
sentences.chinese: 其实，散弹枪都是很好的家庭防御武器。

sentences.english: Random Submachine Gun, Shotgun, and Pistol at beginning of round.
sentences.chinese: 随机枪械组合，包含冲锋枪，散弹枪和手枪。

sentences.english: The shotgun is a better anti-zombie strategy than cremation.
sentences.chinese: 相比火，散弹枪是更好的打僵尸武器。

sentences.english: The Chief said once no one can stare down a shotgun .
sentences.chinese: 一旦没有人能注视下来一个散弹猎枪，领袖说。

sentences.english: Police are again using shotguns loaded with beanbags rubber bullets to disperse the crowds.
sentences.chinese: 警察再次使用装满橡胶弹的散弹枪来驱散人群。

sentences.english: We incorporate a loaded shotgun in our home defense planning.
sentences.chinese: 我们纳入散弹枪在我们的家防卫计划。

sentences.english: Rationing:Kill an enemy with your shotgun while you're out of minigun ammo.
sentences.chinese: 当你机枪没子弹时，用散弹枪解决敌人。

sentences.english: The Shot Pistol has two barrels and fires buckshot rounds creating a wider firing cone and high damage up close.
sentences.chinese: 拥有双管的散弹手枪，范围攻击，越近杀伤力越高。

definition: gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
